1.name: Casablanca
1.description: A cynical nightclub owner protects an old flame and her husband from Nazis in Morocco.

2.name: The Black Swan
2.description: An ex-pirate contends with rowdy buccaneers and a love-hate relationship with an aristocratic woman who's tougher than she seems.

3.name: Bambi
3.description: The story of a young deer growing up in the forest.

4.name: The Young Mr. Pitt
4.description: This biopic tells the story of the life of Pitt The Younger, who became Prime Minister of Great Britain at the age of twenty-four.

5.name: The Pride of the Yankees
5.description: The story of the life and career of famed baseball player Lou Gehrig.

6.name: The Magnificent Ambersons
6.description: The spoiled young heir to the decaying Amberson fortune comes between his widowed mother and the man she has always loved.

7.name: Cat People
7.description: An American man marries a Serbian immigrant who fears that she will turn into the cat person of her homeland's fables if they are intimate together.

8.name: To Be or Not to Be
8.description: During the Nazi occupation of Poland, an acting troupe becomes embroiled in a Polish soldier's efforts to track down a German spy.

9.name: Come on Danger
9.description: Ranger Jack Mason is sent to Manzanita to bring in Ann Jordan, head of the Jordan gang, reputed to have murdered a rancher and stolen his herd. Mason helps her out during an ambush and, ...                See full summary »

10.name: Mrs. Miniver
10.description: A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II.

11.name: This Gun for Hire
11.description: When assassin Philip Raven shoots a blackmailer and his beautiful female companion dead, he is paid off in marked bills by his treasonous employer who is working with foreign spies.

12.name: The Talk of the Town
12.description: An escaped prisoner and a stuffy law professor vie for the hand of a spirited schoolteacher.

13.name: Yankee Doodle Dandy
13.description: The life of the renowned musical composer, playwright, actor, dancer, and singer George M. Cohan.

14.name: Now, Voyager
14.description: A frumpy spinster blossoms under therapy and becomes an elegant, independent woman.

15.name: Saboteur
15.description: An aircraft factory worker goes on the run after being wrongly accused of starting a fire that killed his best friend.

16.name: Jungle Book
16.description: A boy raised by wolves tries to adapt to human village life.

17.name: Holiday Inn
17.description: At an inn which is only open on holidays, a crooner and a hoofer vie for the affections of a beautiful up-and-coming performer.

18.name: Flying Tigers
18.description: Capt. Jim Gordon's command of the famed American mercenary fighter group in China is complicated by the recruitment of an old friend who is a reckless hotshot.

19.name: Reunion in France
19.description: Frenchwoman Michele de la Becque, an opponent of the Nazis in German-occupied Paris, hides a downed American flyer, Pat Talbot, and attempts to get him safely out of the country.

20.name: Random Harvest
20.description: An amnesiac World War I veteran falls in love with a music hall star, only to suffer an accident which restores his original memories but erases his post-war life.

21.name: In Which We Serve
21.description: This "story of a ship", the British destroyer H.M.S. Torrin, is told in flashbacks by survivors as they cling to a life raft.

22.name: Sherlock Holmes and the Voice of Terror
22.description: When a Nazi saboteur jeeringly predicts to the nation new depredations, via their radio 'Voice of Terror', the Intellegence Inner Council summons Sherlock Holmes (Basil Rathbone) to help in...                See full summary »

23.name: Woman of the Year
23.description: Rival reporters Sam and Tess fall in love and get married, only to find their relationship strained when Sam comes to resent Tess' hectic lifestyle.

24.name: Reap the Wild Wind
24.description: Florida ship salvager, Loxi, falls for Jack, captain of a ship wrecked on the Key West shore. However, their romance is complicated by the arrival of another suitor, and eventually leads to tragedy.

25.name: The Ghost of Frankenstein
25.description: When Ygor brings the Monster to Dr. Ludwig Frankenstein for care, Ludwig gets the idea of replacing the Monster's current criminal brain with a normal one.

26.name: The Major and the Minor
26.description: A woman disguises herself as a child to save on a train fare and is taken in charge by an army man who doesn't notice the truth.

27.name: The Glass Key
27.description: A crooked politician finds himself being accused of murder by a gangster from whom he refused help during a re-election campaign.

28.name: Somewhere I'll Find You
28.description: Two brother, rival correspondents, find themselves fighting their conservative editor over stories and each other of over the affections of a pretty blonde journalist.

29.name: The Man Who Came to Dinner
29.description: When acerbic critic Sheridan Whiteside slips on the front steps of a provincial Ohio businessman's home and breaks his hip, he and his entourage take over the house indefinitely.

30.name: Kings Row
30.description: The dark side and hypocrisy of provincial American life is seen through the eyes of five children as they grow to adulthood at the turn-of-the-century.

31.name: Tales of Manhattan
31.description: A formal tailcoat that gets passed from one owner to another affects each life in a significant way.

32.name: Road to Morocco
32.description: Two carefree castaways on a desert shore find an Arabian Nights city, where they compete for the luscious Princess Shalmar.

33.name: The Old Chisholm Trail
33.description: Dusty Gardner, bringing a herd up the Chisholm Trail, is looking for water. Belle Turner has water but wants an exorbitant price for it. When Dusty and his men start a well, Belle and her ...                See full summary »

34.name: We Were Dancing
34.description: Two titled aristocrats support themselves by being professional house guests in the homes of star-struck American nouveau riche.

35.name: The Mummy's Tomb
35.description: A high priest travels to America with a living mummy to kill those who had desecrated the tomb of an Egyptian princess thirty years earlier.

36.name: You Were Never Lovelier
36.description: In Buenos Aires, a man who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age allows an American dancer to perform at his club under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter.

37.name: The First of the Few
37.description: Aircraft designer/patriot R. J. Mitchell, alarmed at growing German militarism, works to perfect a defense against the German Messerschmidt at the cost of his health.

38.name: The Living Ghost
38.description: Wise-cracking ex-detective Nick Trayne is called in to try to find the whereabouts of wealthy kidnap victim Walter Craig. Craig unexpectedly turns up alive but with apparent brain damage, ...                See full summary »

39.name: All Through the Night
39.description: Runyonesque Broadway gamblers turn patriotic when they stumble onto a cell of Nazi saboteurs.

40.name: The Palm Beach Story
40.description: An inventor needs cash to develop his big idea. His wife, who loves him, decides to raise it for him by divorcing him and marrying a millionaire.

41.name: White Cargo
41.description: The story takes place at a British plantation in Africa where Tondelayo entices all the Brits, especially Harry Witzel.

42.name: One of Our Aircraft Is Missing
42.description: When Nazi anti-aircraft fire damages a British bomber, its crew bails out and seeks help from the Dutch underground.

43.name: Across the Pacific
43.description: In December 1941, ex-army captain Rick Leland boards a Japanese ship heading to Asia via the Panama Canal where his Japanese hosts show interest in the American defense plans for the canal zone.

44.name: Keeper of the Flame
44.description: Journalist Steve O'Malley wants to write a biography of a national hero who died when his car ran off a bridge. Steve receives conflicting reports and tales that make him question what the truth about the hero is.

45.name: My Sister Eileen
45.description: Sisters Ruth and Eileen Sherwood move from Ohio to New York in the hopes of building their careers. Ruth wants to get a job as a writer, while Eileen hopes to succeed on the stage. The two ...                See full summary »

46.name: Arabian Nights
46.description: The caliph of Baghdad must go into hiding with a group of traveling performers when his brother usurps the throne. Both brothers desire a beautiful dancing girl, who is torn between power and true love.

47.name: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
47.description: Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson must protect a Swiss inventor of an advanced bomb sight from falling into German hands.

48.name: I Married a Witch
48.description: A beautiful 17th-century witch returns to life to plague politician Wallace Wooley, descendant of her persecutor.

49.name: Roxie Hart
49.description: Roxie Hart signs a murder confession in order to attract publicity for her dancing career as dames don't swing in Cook County. Will everything go as planned?

50.name: Once Upon a Honeymoon
50.description: In Europe at the start of World War II, a woman notices that wherever her husband goes, the Nazis seem to follow. Meanwhile, a charming reporter is following them.
